She waited in the dragon's keep in the highest room of the tallest tower for her true love and true love's first kiss.

Dialogue: Oh, I understand. Like you said, "Who could love a hideous, ugly beast?"

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: But I thought that wouldn't matter to you.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Yeah? Well, it does.  Ah, right on time. Princess, I've brought you a little something.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: What'd I miss? What'd I miss?  Who said that? Couldn't have been the donkey.

Speaker: farquaad
Dialogue: Princess Fiona.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: As promised. Now hand it over.

Speaker: farquaad
Dialogue: Very well, ogre.  Forgive me, Princess, for startling you, but you startled me, for I have never seen such a radiant beauty before. I'm Lord Farquaad.

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Lord Farquaad? Oh, no, no.  farewell.

Speaker: farquaad
Dialogue: Oh, that is so sweet. You don't have to waste good manners on the ogre. It's not like it has feelings.

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: No, you're right. It doesn't.  Donkey watches this exchange with a curious look on his face.

Speaker: farquaad
Dialogue: Princess Fiona, beautiful, fair, flawless Fiona. I ask your hand in marriage. Will you be the perfect bride for the perfect groom?

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Lord Farquaad, I accept. Nothing would make - -

Speaker: farquaad
Dialogue: Excellent! I'll start the plans, for tomorrow we wed!

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: No! I mean, uh, why wait? Let's get married today before the sun sets.

Speaker: farquaad
Dialogue: Oh, anxious, are you? You're right. The sooner, the better. There's so much to do! There's the caterer, the cake, the band, the guest list. Captain, round up some guests!

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Fare-thee-well, ogre.  Farquaad's whole party begins to head back to DuLoc. Donkey watches them go.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Shrek, what are you doing? You're letting her get away.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Yeah? So what?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Shrek, there's something about her you don't know. Look, I talked to her last night, She's - -

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: I know you talked to her last night. You're great pals, aren't ya? Now, if you two are such good friends, why don't you follow her home?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Shrek, I - - I wanna go with you.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: I told you, didn't I? You're not coming home with me. I live alone! My swamp! Me! Nobody else! Understand? Nobody! Especially useless, pathetic, annoying, talking donkeys!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: But I thought - -

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Yeah. You know what? You thought wrong!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Shrek.  Montage of different scenes. Shrek arriving back home. Fiona being fitted for the wedding dress. Donkey at a stream running into the dragon. Shrek cleaning up his house. Fiona eating dinner alone. Shrek eating dinner alone.

Speaker: shrek's home
Dialogue: Shrek is eating dinner when he hears a sound outside. He goes outside to investigate.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Donkey?  What are you doing?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: I would think, of all people, you would recognize a wall when you see one.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Well, yeah. But the wall's supposed to go around my swamp, not through it.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: It is around your half. See that's your half, and this is my half.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oh! Your half. Hmm.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Yes, my half. I helped rescue the princess. I did half the work. I get half the booty. Now hand me that big old rock, the one that looks like your head.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Back off!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: No, you back off.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: This is my swamp!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Our swamp.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Let go, Donkey!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: You let go.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Stubborn jackass!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Smelly ogre.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Fine!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Hey, hey, come back here. I'm not through with you yet.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Well, I'm through with you.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Uh-uh. You know, with you it's always, "Me, me, me!" Well, guess what! Now it's my turn! So you just shut up and pay attention! You are mean to me. You insult me and you don't appreciate anything that I do! You're always pushing me around or pushing me away.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oh, yeah? Well, if I treated you so bad, how come you came back?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Because that's what friends do! They forgive each other!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oh, yeah. You're right, Donkey. I forgive you... for stabbin' me in the back!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Ohh! You're so wrapped up in layers, onion boy, you're afraid of your own feelings.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Go away!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: There you are , doing it again just like you did to Fiona. All she ever do was like you, maybe even love you.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Love me? She said I was ugly, a hideous creature. I heard the two of you talking.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: She wasn't talkin' about you. She was talkin' about, uh, somebody else.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: She wasn't talking about me? Well, then who was she talking about?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Uh-uh, no way. I ain't saying anything. You don't wanna listen to me. Right? Right?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Donkey!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Okay, look. I'm sorry, all right?  I'm sorry. I guess I am just a big, stupid, ugly ogre. Can you forgive me?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Hey, that's what friends are for, right?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Right. Friends?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Friends.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: So, um, what did Fiona say about me?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: What are you asking me for? Why don't you just go ask her?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: The wedding! We'll never make it in time.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Ha-ha-ha! Never fear, for where, there's a will, there's a way and I have a way.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Donkey?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: I guess it's just my animal magnetism.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Aw, come here, you.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: All right, all right. Don't get all slobbery. No one likes a kiss ass. All right, hop on and hold on tight. I haven't had a chance to install the seat belts yet.

Dialogue: People of DuLoc, we gather here today to bear witness to the union....

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Um-

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: ...of our new king...

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Excuse me. Could we just skip ahead to the "I do's"?

Dialogue: Go on.

Dialogue: Some guards are milling around. Suddenly the dragon lands with a boom. The guards all take off running.

Dialogue: Shrek, wait, wait! Wait a minute! You wanna do this right, don't you?

Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: There's a line you gotta wait for. The preacher's gonna say, "Speak now or forever hold your peace." That's when you say, "I object!"

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: I don't have time for this!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Hey, wait. What are you doing? Listen to me! Look, you love this woman, don't you?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Yes.

Dialogue: You wanna hold her?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Please her?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Yes!

Dialogue: The chicks love that romantic crap!

Dialogue: All right! Cut it out. When does this guy say the line?

Dialogue: We gotta check it out.

Dialogue: What do you see?

Dialogue: The whole town's in there.

Dialogue: I now pronounce you husband and wife...

Dialogue: Mother Fletcher! He already said it.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oh, for the love of Pete!  He runs inside without catching Donkey, who hits the ground hard.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: I object!

Dialogue: Shrek?

Dialogue: Oh, now what does he want?

Dialogue: Hi, everyone. Havin' a good time, are ya? I love DuLoc, first of all. Very clean.

Dialogue: What are you doing here?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Really, it's rude enough being alive when no one wants you, but showing up uninvited to a wedding...

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Fiona! I need to talk to you.

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Oh, now you wanna talk? It's a little late for that, so if you'll excuse me - -

Dialogue: But you can't marry him.

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: And why not?

Dialogue: Because- - Because he's just marring you so he can be king.

Dialogue: He's not your true love.

Dialogue: Well, I - - Uh - - I mean - -

Dialogue: Shrek, is this true?

Dialogue: Who cares? It's preposterous! Fiona, my love, we're but a kiss away from our "happily ever after." Now kiss me!

Dialogue: All right. Nobody move. I got a dragon here, and I'm not afraid to use it.  I'm a donkey on the edge!
